com.polarion.alm.ws.client.session

Interface SessionWebService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote

    public interface SessionWebService
extends java.rmi.Remote

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void beginTransaction()
      Starts a explicit transaction for the current session.
      void endSession()
      Terminates the current session.
      void endTransaction(boolean rollback)
      Ends the explicit transaction of the current session by either commit or rollback.
      boolean hasSubject()
      Checks if a user is logged-in for the current session.
      void logIn(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String password)
      Logs a user in for the current session.
      void logInWithToken(java.lang.String mechanism, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String token)
      Logs a user in for the current session.
      boolean transactionExists()
      Check if there is a explicit transaction (started with beginTransaction) for the current session.

    • Method Detail

      • beginTransaction

        void beginTransaction()
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Starts a explicit transaction for the current session. Usually transactions are started and committed for each call to the webservice, but if a transaction has been started explicitly it also has to be terminated using endTransaction.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • endSession

        void endSession()
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Terminates the current session.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • endTransaction

        void endTransaction(boolean rollback)
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Ends the explicit transaction of the current session by either commit or rollback.
        Parameters:
        rollback - if true the transaction is rolled back otherwise it is commited.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • hasSubject

        boolean hasSubject()
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Checks if a user is logged-in for the current session.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • logIn

        void logIn(java.lang.String userName,
           java.lang.String password)
    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Logs a user in for the current session.
        Parameters:
        userName - the name of the user to log-in.
        password - the password of the user to log-in.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • logInWithToken

        void logInWithToken(java.lang.String mechanism,
                    java.lang.String username,
                    java.lang.String token)
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Logs a user in for the current session.
        Parameters:
        mechanism - the mechanism which client request for authentication (server must be configured for given mechanism otherwise login will be rejected)
        username - the name of the user to log-in.
        token - the token of the user to log-in.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        Since:
        3.17.0

      • transactionExists

        boolean transactionExists()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Check if there is a explicit transaction (started with beginTransaction) for the current session.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
